text: And this is what a jail in downtown Manhattan near the civic center could look like once it’s completed:
author: GloriaPazmino

text: Officials say the height of the buildings proposed for each new facility have been reduced. Elizabeth Glazer, director of Mayor’s Office of Criminal Justice says changes are in response to public comments:
author: GloriaPazmino

text:
Also expected from the briefing:

An arraignment facility originally proposed for the Bronx facility will   be eliminated and kept in the Bronx court.

The plan will also include some changes for parole offenders specifically.
author: GloriaPazmino

text:
Some of the news expected at the briefing: 

City has a plan to create a women’s only facility which will be included at the Queens site.

They have agreed to lower the height of every single proposed facility. The Manhattan site will see a 40 feet reduction.
author: GloriaPazmino

text: Members of @NYCMayor administration will hold a briefing this afternoon on the most recent Environmental Impact Study for the “four modern, community-based jails that will replace Rikers Island”
author: GloriaPazmino

text: On this point that @AIPAC doesn’t invite presidential candidates to speak, which @NYCMayor keeps arguing, they told us yesterday they “have had presidential candidates in actual election years speaking at the conference,” in the past @BrianLehrer
author: GloriaPazmino

text: “You’re really making powerful arguments,” @NYCMayor says to a caller upset she won’t be allowed to feed city squirrels.
author: GloriaPazmino

text: "Not entirely surprised. Greatly disappointed, but this is, in many ways, in line with de Blasio's history of being pretty late to the game when it comes to where the progressive movement is headed,"

text: Assemblywoman @AMBichotte says she cannot support congestion pricing in its current form. @NYCMayor lightly pushes back, he talks about the “urgency” and how this is an alternative he “came up with with the Governor,”

text: Here at this press conference with @NYCMayor where both members of the Senate and Assembly are present it is pretty obvious that congestion pricing is nowhere near being done or agreed on, on either side. Mayor rode the train here in support of passing it.

text: “The bill would also provide a path for permanent legal status if they meet the requirements,”
author: GloriaPazmino

text: “The American Dream and Promise Act of 2019 would provide dreamers, temporary protected status holders, and people with with deferred enforced departure with deportation protection.”
author: GloriaPazmino

text: “When people came here and they were in these tenements.. when the Italians were here they were called “wops” you know what that means? Without papers..that’s all we’re talking about here,” @SpeakerPelosi
author: GloriaPazmino

text: “I came here when I was two and a half years old, so basically New York is the only home I know,” Vanessa, immigrant advocate says. “We want a clean Dream Act,”
author: GloriaPazmino

text: “You are the Italian American who has reached the highest,” @NYCMayor tells @SpeakerPelosi
author: GloriaPazmino

text: “We say that yesterday’s immigrants are worthy but today’s are not somehow,” @NYCMayor “This legislation’s time has come. For hundred of thousands of families, they still live in fear.”
author: GloriaPazmino

text: Now, @NYCMayor is telling the story of his grandparents who came to America from Italy. “They lived near here, and even though neither of them could dream of college, their daughters went to college.”
author: GloriaPazmino

text: The bill has 210 Co-sponsors. “I expect it will move through the judiciary committee and not long after that it will pass on the House floor,” @NydiaVelazquez says.
author: GloriaPazmino

text: .@NYCMayor is at the Tenement Museum this morning standing with @SpeakerPelosi who just got introduced as “the leader of the free world,” and @NydiaVelazquez. They’re in support of the American Dream and Promise Act of 2019.
author: GloriaPazmino

text: Thank you ! I am very excited.  @APT78 dream team never forgets!
author: GloriaPazmino

text: Five to air!  Tune into ⁦@InsideCityHall⁩ tonight as we check in with ⁦@gracerauh⁩ who is following ⁦@NYCMayor⁩ in New Hampshire. ⁦@ZackFinkNews⁩ has a report on mayoral control and I take a look at #HudsonYards:
author: GloriaPazmino

text: #HudsonYards is open for business. @NYCMayor missed the big opening party and his office told us he “can’t be everywhere.” With Hudson Yards finished and Amazon dead, what will the fate of the city’s next mega project look like ? Tune into @InsideCityHall tonight.
author: GloriaPazmino
